directions.d: Whisk the eggs and cheese in a stainless steel bowl until thick.
Bring a pan with 2 tablespoon of water into a simmer,
Place bowl with eggs ontop of the water. Careful to not let eggs get to hot or they will scramble.
Whisk eggs while slowly adding the melted cup of butter, 1 or 2 tablespoons at a time.
Whisk in salt and pepper to taste.
While Whisking if sauce becomes too thick, a teaspoon or two of the hot water.
Bring a 10 inch sauce pan half filled with water and vinegar to a boil.
Carefully break an egg into the water and vinegar. The vinegar keeps the egg from seperating.
Let sit for 2 and a half to 3 minutes.
Place canadian bacon onto a lightly greased pan.
Brown each side over a medium-medium high heat.
Brown the english muffins in the oven. Careful not to burn the muffins.
Place the muffin down on a dish, topped with canadian bacon, and then the egg.
Drizzle the Hollendaise sauce over the egg and serve.
